title: 108_hr2480
content: Estate and gift tax rates reduced to 30 percent. The estate tax under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to impose a tax equal to 30 percent of the sum of the taxable estate and adjusted taxable gifts, minus the tax paid on gifts made after December 31, 1976. The estate tax under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 imposes a tax of 30 percent on the sum of the taxable estate and adjusted taxable gifts, minus the tax paid on gifts made after December 31, 1976. Amendments include changes to the computation of tax rates and adjustments to exemption amounts. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to adjust exemption amounts for estate and gift taxes. The taxable estate and adjusted taxable gifts are subject to a 30 percent tax rate, with changes to tax rates and exemption amounts. The tax rate for taxable gifts is 30 percent, to be paid by the donor. Section 2504 is removed, and the effective date is after the enactment of the Act. The unified credit is increased to $10,000,000 with an inflation adjustment. The applicable exclusion amount in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is set at $10,000,000 with a cost-of-living adjustment for decedents and gifts made after 2003. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 sets the applicable exclusion amount at $10,000,000 with adjustments for inflation. Amendments in the text specify rounding rules for adjusted amounts and change the exclusion amount in a conforming amendment. The effective date for these changes applies to estates of decedents dying and gifts made after the enactment of the Act. The annual gift tax exclusion is increased to $50,000, effective for gifts made after December 31, 2002.
